intro: Hieracium levigatifolium, commonly known as the smooth-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are generally smooth and lance-shaped, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite inflorescence. It is often found in open habitats and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
